Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the exterior is covered with a self-slip, now much darkened by the application of a varnish-like substance, and remains of five lines of black-painted hieratic text of unknown character.
Curator's comments: Bib: R.J. Demaree, Ramesside Ostraca (London, 2002), p.38, pl.154 G.Brunton, Matmar (London 1948), pp.67 and 72
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393591) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393591)
